message: Looking for tips, sites, or services that aid Django deployment
well django is a framework so i don't think there are hosting centers that would help in that, but just look for a good python host

@loganlinn Services > http://ep.io, http://gondor.io, http://dotcloud.com... Tips: @jacobian's Django Deployment Workshop > http://ontwik.com/python/django-deployment-workshop-by-jacob-kaplan-moss/ (There's an updated version from the last PyCon but I can't seem to find the recorded video.)
@micrypt Tutorials weren't recorded this year (or likely in the future either, it is a dicely legal matter to do so, and expensive)
There is a Chef group here on Convore, as well as a Django Community group, those are probably places to start.
I made this fabric script (fabfile) that automates the process (one command) of creating and setting up an Amazon EC2 server for django deployment. Give it a try https://github.com/gcollazo/Fabulous
@coderanger Can you explain the legal matters? Asking because we have to decide if we record tutorials at PyCon DE 2011.
Steve Losh has written a good blog post on Django development and deployment http://stevelosh.com/blog/2011/06/django-advice/

@keimlink Most people giving tutorials at PyCon do Python training as part of their job (either full-time training, or just when they have time). Putting up video of the tutorial is a threat to their livelihood as people are far less likely to pay for a class when a video is online for free. The legal issues came into when we discussed trying to put them up behind a pay-wall, but this would leave the PSF liable for the inevitable leak.
@gcollazo I was the guy on Reddit that said its logo should be a rainbow :)
